item.description:
Still love the German series at Coolidge. (But less thrilled with the change to an 11 am start time.) The Sunday matinees in partnership with the Goethe-Institut Boston showcase a sampling of new and award-winning German films rarely shown outside Europe.

About Lumber Kings:

The lovely and charismatic loser Krischan (Bjarne MÃ¤del) comes back after 12 years to his working class village Tanne in the Harz mountains, planning to hold a lumber jack competition there. He manages not only to overcome the massive resistance of his old friends Ronnie (Frank Auerbach) and Bert (Steven Merting), who had to pay off a huge debt after Krischan left, but also transforms the whole economically depressed village, saving it from a state of stagnancy and resignation. (comedy, 2006, Germany) dir. Matthias Keilich, DVD, 94 min

After the movie, we'll go to an area restaurant for lunch and discussion of the film.

Hope to see you there!

Lisa
item.how_to_find_us: After the movie I'll stand near the theater exit holding a Meetup sign.
item.name: Koenige der Nutzholzgewinnung (Lumber Kings)
